intro: Batrachium confusum, commonly known as the confused batrachium, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
